title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" is cited as the short title. Title 18 of the United States Code is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" amends Title 18 of the United States Code to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors across state lines for abortions, in violation of parental involvement laws. Offenders face fines, imprisonment, or both. The "Child Custody Protection Act" imposes penalties for transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent or notification. Offenders may face fines, imprisonment, or both. Exceptions to the prohibition of transporting minors across state lines for abortions without parental consent include cases where the abortion is necessary to save the minor's life due to physical disorders, injuries, or illnesses related to the pregnancy. Minors and their parents cannot be prosecuted or sued for violating this law in such circumstances. The section prohibits violations and conspiracies related to minors' abortions without parental consent. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed parental consent or notification had been obtained before the abortion. The section prohibits violations and conspiracies related to minors' abortions without parental consent. Any parent who suffers harm from a violation may obtain relief in a civil action. Definitions for a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision are provided. The section prohibits violations and conspiracies related to minors' abortions without parental consent. Definitions for a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision are provided, including the term 'parent' which encompasses a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or a person standing in loco parentis. The term 'minor' refers to an individual who is not older than the maximum age requiring parental notification or consent for abortion, as specified by the law. The law designates a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or a person standing in loco parentis as individuals who must be notified or provide consent for the minor's abortion decision. The term 'minor' refers to an individual not older than the age requiring parental involvement in abortion decisions. The term 'State' includes the District of Columbia and other territories of the United States. Transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion.
